div.div: Home > Inside RIDE > Additional Information > Covid19

div.p: Updates and resources for the Rhode Island community about the coronavirus.

li.strong: Teachers, parents, and guardians can call the RI Distance Learning Helpline at 904-414-4927 or fill out the online form at http://highlanderinstitute.org/distance-learning-helpline/ to get their distance learning questions answered.
Commissioner Infante-Green issued Distance Learning Guidance to ensure educators, families and students are supported.
RIDE issued Educator Evaluation Guidance for the 2019-2020 school year.
Friday, April 3 and Friday, April 17 will be planning or professional development days for district staff. Thursday, April 9 and Friday, April 10 are vacation days for all LEAs.
We are more than halfway through the April Reading Challenge. Students can visit the reading log to record total minutes they read each day.

div.h3: Rhode Island Department of Education Operations
div.p:
As we strive to keep our students and community healthy and safe during the COVID-19 pandemic, we would like to give you some updates about how RIDE is continuing to support students and LEAs.Governor Raimondo announced that effective March 17 until further notice that state agencies will be closing customer-facing lobby operations. At RIDE, this means the reception area and in-person certification office will be closed, and we will not hold in-person meetings or events.
Our RIDE team will continue to be available to you by email or phone:

ul.li: For general issues or questions, please email info@ride.ri.gov or call 401-222-4600
For educator certification issues or questions, please email EQAC@ride.ri.gov
For testing issues or questions, please email assessment@ride.ri.gov
For legal issues or questions, please email legal@ride.ri.gov

div.p: Thank you for your understanding and patience during this challenging time.
We want to ensure you have access to the latest information about COVID-19.

ul.li: The Rhode Island Department of Health COVID-19 Website has the latest news and resources for Rhode Islanders.
The Rhode Island Department of Health has a 24-hour hotline for anyone with questions about the Coronavirus (401-222-8022). Rhode Islanders can also call 211 for assistance.
Visit RI Delivers if you are in quarantine or isolation at home due to COVID-19

li.a: CDC's frequently Asked Questions regarding Children
el Ciere de la Escuelas de Rhode Island

ul.li:
The RIDE Team has created:
A Distance Learning Resource Guide by topic, subject and grade that will be updated regularly
A COVID-19 Special Education Resources web page for educators, families and providers
A COVID-19 Multilingual Learner Resources web page for educators and families

Understanding the importance of taking care of ourselves during this stressful time, please check out the following video wellness sessions from Pure Edge:
Educator Self-Care
Family Self-Care
The Neuroscience of Stress and Strategies to Manage It
Amazing Educational Resources is a website with a list of education companies offering free subscriptions due to school closings
The Rhode Island Distance Learning Hotline is a statewide, free helpline for educators to schedule one-to-one coaching sessions with the Highlander Institute's RI Fuse Fellows
Rhode Island PBS LearningMedia provides thousands of free PBS-based PreK-12 media resources for educators, students, and families
Microsoft is offering six months of Office 365 tools for free to schools to enable remote collaboration, file sharing and video conferencing
NBC Learn is available for free to Rhode Island educators and schools

li.a: Access a full list of free food sites for children in Rhode Island

ul.li: COVID-19 information for families from RIDOH and RIDE / información sobre coronavirus para familias del RIDOH y RIDE

li.a: Learn more about accessing the internet at home

ul.li: View updates on AP testing for students

Families can call Kids Link, a hotline that operates 24 hours a day, 7 days a week at 1-855-543-5465 when their child is feeling excessive anger or sadness; lashing out at siblings, friends and adults; having severe worries; or hurting him or herself or others.
View our list of resources for distance learning and working with your child at home (preview provided in image)

a.title: The Office of Finance calculates, manages, and distributes State and Federal Funding from the RI State Department of Education, including Funding Formula Aid, Consolidated Resource Program grants, and Race to the Top. Links to key web sites such as Accelegrants and state Office of Purchasing. Regents’ budget request for the Department.
The Human Resources Office at the Rhode Island Department of Elementary and Secondary Education.
This page contains information relating to the function and operations of RIDE’s Legal Department.

College and Career Readiness: Working to ensure that every Rhode Island student has access to and participates in the educational opportunities that best prepare them for success in college, career, and life.

Ensure that children with diverse learning needs and special education services are provided equal access to a public education and that schools develop effective strategies for meeting the needs of these unique learners.
